member.name: T:devDept.Graphics.textureFilteringFunctionType
member.summary: The texture filtering function is used whenever the pixel being textured maps to an area greater (minifying function) or smaller (magnifying function) than one texture element. There are six defined filtering functions. Two of them use the nearest one or nearest four texture elements to compute the texture value. The other four use mipmaps.

member.name: F:devDept.Graphics.textureFilteringFunctionType.Nearest
member.summary: Returns the value of the texture element that is nearest (in Manhattan distance) to the center of the pixel being textured.

member.name: F:devDept.Graphics.textureFilteringFunctionType.Linear
member.summary: Returns the weighted average of the four texture elements that are closest to the center of the pixel being textured.

member.name: F:devDept.Graphics.textureFilteringFunctionType.NearestMipmapNearest
member.summary: Chooses the mipmap that most closely matches the size of the pixel being textured and uses the Nearest criterion (the texture element nearest to the center of the pixel) to produce a texture value.

member.name: F:devDept.Graphics.textureFilteringFunctionType.LinearMipmapNearest
member.summary: Chooses the mipmap that most closely matches the size of the pixel being textured and uses the Linear criterion (a weighted average of the four texture elements that are closest to the center of the pixel) to produce a texture value.

member.name: F:devDept.Graphics.textureFilteringFunctionType.NearestMipmapLinear
member.summary: Chooses the two mipmaps that most closely match the size of the pixel being textured and uses the Nearest criterion (the texture element nearest to the center of the pixel) to produce a texture value from each mipmap. The final texture value is a weighted average of those two values.

member.name: F:devDept.Graphics.textureFilteringFunctionType.LinearMipmapLinear
member.summary: Chooses the two mipmaps that most closely match the size of the pixel being textured and uses the Linear criterion (a weighted average of the four texture elements that are closest to the center of the pixel) to produce a texture value from each mipmap. The final texture value is a weighted average of those two values.

member.name: P:devDept.Graphics.Material.MinifyingFunction
member.summary: Gets or sets the texture minifying function. The texture minifying function is used whenever the pixel being textured maps to an area greater than one texture element. There are six defined minifying functions. Two of them use the nearest one or nearest four texture elements to compute the texture value. The other four use mipmaps.

member.name: P:devDept.Graphics.Material.MagnifyingFunction
member.summary: Gets or sets the texture magnifying function. The texture magnifying function is used whenever the pixel being textured maps to an area smaller than one texture element. There are six defined minifying functions. Two of them use the nearest one or nearest four texture elements to compute the texture value. The other four use mipmaps.

member.name: P:devDept.Graphics.Material.RepeatX
member.summary: Gets or sets the texture repeat mode in the X direction.
member.remarks: If true, values outside [0,1] are mapped to the [0,1] range. If false, values less than 0 are mapped to 0 and values greater than 1 are mapped to 1.

member.name: P:devDept.Graphics.Material.RepeatY
member.summary: Gets or sets the texture repeat mode in the Y direction.
member.remarks: If true, values outside [0,1] are mapped to the [0,1] range. If false, values less than 0 are mapped to 0 and values greater than 1 are mapped to 1.
